review_blob: Bottle to glass mug. Pours an amber color with sparse white head. Good hop notes and overall bitterness. Good pale ale example
Can to shaker glass. Pours an amber copper color with a sparse off white head. Roasted malt nose, and sweet malt flavors. Not too much hop coming through. Palate on the watery side. Good
Can to shaker glass. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with white head. Good lacing. Hop nose, but not too powerful. Good body and crisp finish of hop citrus, but just a little one dimensional
Bottle to glass mug. Pours a cloudy brown copper color with a decent white head. I dont get much nose from this. Actually, I dont get much flavor either. Kinda light. Maybe a bad try.
Bottle to glass mug. Pours a cloudy yellow with a sparse white head. Great hop nose, and great hop flavors
Bottle to glass mug. Pours a cloudy yellow with sparse head. Great mouthfeel with malt backbone and lots of hop notes

Bottle to glass mug. Pours a cloudy copper / yellow color with a sparse off white head. Aroma of floral and citrus, nice mouthfeel, chewy with a good malt backbone. Great hop notes of floral and citrus coming through on flavor. Very solid.
Bottle to glass mug. Pours a crystal clear yellow with sparse white head. Doughy sour bread nose, crisp light taste. Some bitter hops, but very light. Kinda like a champagne beer.
Bottle to glass mug. Pours a clear light yellow with a sparse white head. Good hop nose of citurs / pine. Light on the palate, but the flavor is good, like lemon drops. Pretty nice session beer.
Bottle to snifter glass. Pours a cloudy yellow. Nose like a heffe and some fruit hop notes. Bready chewy heffe flavor with hop notes. Good
Bottle to snifter glass. A little watery, and I dont get a ton of maple out of it. Still, overall its a good imperial. Roasted malts etc.
Bottle to porter glass. Pours dark black and opaque. Great malt nose and flavors of chocolate and coffee. Delicious
Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a clear yellow with a moderate white head. Super hoppy, and great citrus and pine flavors. Awesome

Bottle to tulip glass. Pours a cloudy yellow with no head. Strong lime notes and other fruit. Very very tart and is super citrus, obviously lime. Thin mouthfeel. This is pretty straight forward without too much complexity.
Bomber to shaker glass. Pours a clear copper with an off white head. Aroma of hops, but taste is really dominated by the belgian. It is pretty good, tea like flavors, great finish. Pretty nice.
beer_name: Stone / Ecliptic / Wicked Weed Points Unknown IPA

review_blob: Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a clear light yellow with a decent white head. Some citrus notes on the nose, but not much else. A tad thin on the mouthfeel, but good bitter hop character. Somewhat watery.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a dark root beer color with a sparse off white head that dissapates quickly. Great roasted malt aroma with fruity hop notes. Goes right into a simlar flavor with a great mouthfeel, and decieving ABV. Pretty nice.
Bottle to pilsner glass. Pours a cloudy yellow with sparse head. A fluffy soapy mouthfeel with lemon flavors and bread yeasty notes.

Bottle to porter glass. Pours a cloudy brown / rootbeer color. Sparse off white head that dissipates quickly. Great nose of coffee and some malt. The mouthfeel is really silky, and the coffee is really dominant great smoothness, and oatmeal flavor. Nice.
beer_name: Free Will Coffee Oatmeal Brown Ale

review_blob: Bottle to corona glass. Pours a copper color with sparse head that dissipates quickly. Kinda bitter taste despite the malty nose. I do get citrus out of this, but its not too awesome.
Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a cloudy copper and has a malty nose. First taste is malty and sweet with enough hop bitter to make a nice balance.
Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a nice copper color, and no head at all. Sweet aroma of malts on the nose. Very sweet and malty flavors. I dont get a whole lot of hop notes out of this.

Bomber to shaker glass. Pours a nice darkish yellow and is cloudy. Aroma of green tea obvious on the nose. Great mouthfeel, and the green tea really comes through, but is balanced well with the hoppy IPA character. Awesome beer.
beer_name: Baird / Ishii / Stone Japanese Green Tea IPA 10.1% (2015)

review_blob: Drinking this right from the widemouth can. Cant really see the color, but it looks amberish. Nice hop nose, good bitterness and nice mouthfeel. Interesting presentation.

Bomber to shaker glass. Pours an opaque black, with a tan, sparse head. Not much nose to it, but WOW the first sip is super sweet like syrup and you really get the raspberry and chocolate. A sipper dessert beer for sure.

Bomber to tulip glass. Pours a clear copper / amber with a white frothy head that lingers. Looks like good lacing. A sour / bitter nose, the flavor is hoppy, but somewhat sour. I dont get any granola out of this. Possibly some honey notes. Pretty malty and sweet. Light mouthfeel, and you cant tell at all its 9% Good, but I dont need any more.
Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a slightly orange-ish copper with a decent head. Not too much nose. Mouthfeel on the watery side, and while the hop content is good, its not overwhelming. Meh.

Bottle to porter / stout glass. Pours an opaque black with a sparse tan head. Great aromas of roasted malt and some tangy fruit notes. Flavor of roasted malts and chocolate. Really creamy and a little light on the mouthfeel. Good.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a cloudy copper / yellow with an off white head that laces well, but dissapates quickly. Decent nose of hops, and some malt. Flavors reflect the same. Good mouthfeel, and pretty nice.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a clear crisp yellow with a sparse head that dissipates quickly. Great dank, litterbox smell on the nose. Great diverse hop flavors, awesome palate, and great mouthfeel. Excellent beer.

Bottle to porter glass. Pours an opaque black / brown. Has a tan, sparse head. Great lacing, and the flavor is of dates, and fruits, and chocolate / woodsy. Still, not too heavy despite all the flavors.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours a clear yellow, with a sparse head that dissipates quickly. Nose is great with a lot of hop citrus notes. Flavor is really on the citrus lemony side. Light on the palate, and crisp finish. Nice.

Bottle to tulip glass. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head that dissipates quickly. Nose of tart fruit and barnyard scents. Flavor is extremely acidic, and a lot of the same fruit flavors. Admittedly, this is my first lambic, and I thought it would be sweeter. This is very sour.

Bomber to glass shaker. Pours a dark brown / ruby you cant see through. Tan head that dissipates quick. Nose, you can really smell the peppers and nutmeg. Almost smells like celery, or veggies. Flavor is quite different with rich toasted malt and cocoa flavors. Some coffee, but not too pronounced. Different.
beer_name: Chris Banker / Insurgente / Stone Xocoveza Mocha Stout

review_blob: Bomber to glass mug. Pours a dark brown or black. TAn head that dissapates. Fruit flavors, but not much of a hop profile, which is fine. Really smooth and tasty

beer_brewer_name: Coney Island Brewing Company (Boston Beer Company)
review_blob: Bottle to pint shaker. Pours a clear yellow, with sparse white head that dissipates. Strong citrus scents. Good malt backbone, and lemon like hop flavors. Not bad.

beer_brewer_name: Coney Island Brewing Company (Boston Beer Company)
review_blob: Bottle to a shaker glass. Pours a copper color with a while head that is sparse, and dissipates quickly. Nose is sweet, and you can smell espresso beans. Flavor is similar to nose, and it is a sweet October fest, and the beans come across good. Not too bad.

Bomber to tulip glass. Pours a cloudy pinkish color with a white head that dissipates quickly. The nose is of fruit, like grapefruit. Lots of crisp citrus flavors, and other spice like cinnamon, and bready notes probably from the Belgian yeast. I like it.

Cork bomber to snifter. Pours an opaque dark brown / black with a dense tan head that remains the whole time. Good lacing. Deep rich scents of fruit, and coffee, and roasted malts. Not much hop character, however it does have a good bitter twinge. The 10%abv is blended well. Lots of fruit notes, especially prune, and dates.

Bomber to lager glass. Pours a hazy light - medium yellow with a nice white head that holds on good. Great aroma is of floral and citrus hops, but has a wet hop nose to it. Awesome flavors of hops and perfect malt balance, crisp lager finish. Beautiful.
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series #10: Dissenter Imperial IPL

review_blob: Bomber to tulip glass. Pours a cloudy orangish brown. Nice slightly tan head that stays. Great nose of citrus hop aroma, and in addition to lots of hop notes, I get a slight tea flavor. Nice!
Bomber to shaker glass. Pours s hazy yellow with a nice white head, that dissipates quickly. Lots of hop nose, and flavor. Really good.
Bottle to glass mug., Pours a hazy yellow, on the darker side with a white head. Lots of bread and fruit notes on nose. Has a great mouthfeel with similar flavors. Good.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Allagash Beer Camp Myrons Walk

review_blob: Bottle to glass mug. Pours a cloudy copper / brown color. Has malty nose, but the flavors are buttery, and hoppy, but not too hoppy.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Victory Beer Camp Alt Route

review_blob: Bottle to wheat beer glass. Pours a cloudy yellow. Aroma of spice and hops and malt. Great flavors of fruit and hops. Crisp finish.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Russian River Beer Camp Yvan the Great

review_blob: Bottle to pilsner glass. Pours a light, clear yellow with an abundant white foamy head. Nose has some background skunky notes that remind me of pilsners. Flavors are good hop notes, with that pilsner backbone malt and super clean finish.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Firestone Walker Beer Camp Torpedo Pilsner

review_blob: Bottle to English Pint. Pours a cloudy medium yellow, with a nice white head. Some bitterness on the scent, and nice strong hop flavors on the taste.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / New Glarus Beer Camp There And Back

review_blob: Pours a black dark brown in an English pint. Has a nice staying off white head. Really malty. Delicious
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Ninkasi Beer Camp Double Latte

review_blob: Pours a cloudy, dark brown / red color from bottle to shaker glass. Smells like a scottish ale. Dont really get any hop notes. Good flavor and great mouthfeel.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Asheville Brewers Alliance Beer Camp Tater Ridge

review_blob: Pours a clear yellow from bottle to shaker glass. Nose is a really earthy, piney hop note, and seems dense. Palate is a lot of those same hop notes with a moderate malt backbone. REALLY drinkable. Its only 6.2% unlike the deScription up top. Well done Troegs
